during this segment.

374
00:18:58.350 --> 00:19:01.170
But stay tuned because we're
definitely gonna have some episodes on

375
00:19:01.170 --> 00:19:03.950
creating some reports, and
other ways to get data out.

376
00:19:03.950 --> 00:19:07.010
Here, what we've seen in this
episode are ways that we as project

377
00:19:07.010 --> 00:19:09.990
managers are gonna use to
filter the data for us.

378
00:19:09.990 --> 00:19:12.160
But it's still project management data.

379
00:19:12.160 --> 00:19:15.800
Which means it's not necessarily suitable
for people who aren't project managers.

380
00:19:15.800 --> 00:19:18.080
They still don't necessarily
understand what that data is, so

381
00:19:18.080 --> 00:19:22.520
we might need to an extra step of
interpreting that data in pie charts.

382
00:19:22.520 --> 00:19:23.190
Right?
Pictures,

383
00:19:23.190 --> 00:19:25.610
things that are easier to understand,

384
00:19:25.610 --> 00:19:27.570
to be able to distribute out
to non-project managers.

385
00:19:27.570 --> 00:19:29.470
We'll see that in an upcoming segment.

386
00:19:29.470 --> 00:19:30.030
But for right now,

387
00:19:30.030 --> 00:19:32.640
Ronnie is there anything else
you wanna throw in on this one?

388
00:19:32.640 --> 00:19:33.860
>> You just gonna work with it.

389
00:19:33.860 --> 00:19:37.070
There's no for you to go,
I wonder how I can get that view.

390
00:19:37.070 --> 00:19:39.860
Even if somebody tells you, you're not
going to remember every single step, so

391
00:19:39.860 --> 00:19:42.640
the more often that you work with it,
the better you're going to be at it, and

392
00:19:42.640 --> 00:19:44.855
see exactly what you want to see.

393
00:19:44.855 --> 00:19:47.260
>> Alright, well, ladies and
gentlemen, that is our show.

394
00:19:47.260 --> 00:19:48.600
I hope you guys enjoyed it.

395
00:19:48.600 --> 00:19:50.910
Stay tuned, we have more project
management shows coming up

396
00:19:53.170 --> 00:19:56.740
with Microsoft Project 2013, but
for now, signing off for IT Pro TV,

397
00:19:56.740 --> 00:19:57.607
I'm Dom Pezet
>> I'm Ronnie Wong

398
00:19:57.607 --> 00:19:58.325
>> And we'll see you next time

399
00:19:58.325 --> 00:20:03.750
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don take a look at getting Project data available in other applications besides Project. Project 2013 has made it easier to make the project information available beyond the application itself.
episodes.title: Sharing Project Data
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:10.770
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:10.770 --> 00:00:13.211
All right, good morning,
good afternoon and good evening.

3
00:00:13.211 --> 00:00:14.150
And welcome back.

4
00:00:14.150 --> 00:00:16.842
To another episode of
ITProTV I'm your host Don Pezet.

5
00:00:16.842 --> 00:00:18.350
[INAUDIBLE] Mr. Ronnie Wong.

6
00:00:18.350 --> 00:00:19.080
How's it going Ronnie?

7
00:00:19.080 --> 00:00:20.250
>> It is going well today.

8
00:00:20.250 --> 00:00:23.760
We are ready to get started
into Microsoft Project and

9
00:00:23.760 --> 00:00:26.692
looking at some of the ways we
can get the data out of it.

10
00:00:26.692 --> 00:00:28.840
[INAUDIBLE]
>> What you're gonna find is your

11
00:00:28.840 --> 00:00:33.120
project managers, or you, will have
Microsoft Project on your computer but

12
00:00:33.120 --> 00:00:34.900
>> Everybody else in your company doesn't

13
00:00:34.900 --> 00:00:36.570
have it because it's a little expensive,

14
00:00:36.570 --> 00:00:39.440
and we don't necessarily want to
buy it for the mailroom clerk.

15
00:00:39.440 --> 00:00:43.100
But, there might data that's in
project that they need access to.

16
00:00:43.100 --> 00:00:47.005
So, it's really handy to be able to
take data from inside of Project and

17
00:00:47.005 --> 00:00:51.366
pull it out and stick it in some other
software that other people might have, and

18
00:00:51.366 --> 00:00:53.972
then maybe that's Excel, maybe it's Visio,

19
00:00:53.972 --> 00:00:56.885
well odds are they're not
gonna have Visio either.

20
00:00:56.885 --> 00:00:58.790
>> [LAUGH]
>> It might be email,

21
00:00:58.790 --> 00:01:02.130
various other things that people do have,
they have ready access to.

22
00:01:02.130 --> 00:01:03.770
Fortunately, Project
makes that pretty easy.

23
00:01:03.770 --> 00:01:04.490
Doesn't it Ronnie?

24
00:01:04.490 --> 00:01:05.480
>> It really does.

25
00:01:05.480 --> 00:01:08.020
It wants you to actually
understand that hey.

26
00:01:08.020 --> 00:01:09.620
They understand something too.

27
00:01:09.620 --> 00:01:12.570
That project is really designed for
the person using it.

28
00:01:12.570 --> 00:01:14.020
But the data inside of it.

29
00:01:14.020 --> 00:01:16.770
Right, it's not gonna actually be
able to be distributed very easily.

30
00:01:16.770 --> 00:01:20.700
Except for the fact that Project has tried
to say, look, we want this data to go out

31
00:01:20.700 --> 00:01:24.240
to the people that are gonna be making the
decisions or stakeholders, and everyone.

32
00:01:24.240 --> 00:01:26.940
So we wanna make it as
easy as possible and

33
00:01:26.940 --> 00:01:30.645
by doing so, they went ahead and offered
us several different ways we can do that.

34
00:01:30.645 --> 00:01:34.155
Let's go ahead and take a look at some of
them when we start taking a look here.

35
00:01:34.155 --> 00:01:37.435
So when we actually that one of
the first episodes that we did,

36
00:01:37.435 --> 00:01:40.455
we talked about the ways that
we can build a project plan

37
00:01:40.455 --> 00:01:44.555
was by also importing data in
from other applications as well.

38
00:01:44.555 --> 00:01:48.095
And one of the ways that they had pointed
out was the idea of being able to pull it

39
00:01:48.095 --> 00:01:50.880
from, well, Excel instead.

40
00:01:50.880 --> 00:01:55.970
So if I go ahead and make a new
project plan you can see right here

41
00:01:55.970 --> 00:02:00.380
that one of the links that's available
to me is new from an Excel workbook.

42
00:02:00.380 --> 00:02:05.770
So if I select that option, and I have
inside of my shared folder here on my lab.

43
00:02:05.770 --> 00:02:10.280
I don't know why it defaults to XML
format, but mine it defaults there.

44
00:02:10.280 --> 00:02:12.860
If I now just select all files I can see.

45
00:02:12.860 --> 00:02:16.990
Here's a sample of some of the stuff
that I had inside of Excel.

46
00:02:16.990 --> 00:02:17.870
And I can click Open.

47
00:02:19.010 --> 00:02:23.430
And when I do so, it of course, allows me
to walk it through this Import Wizard.

48
00:02:23.430 --> 00:02:27.620
From there I can choose what I'm
going to actually create and map.

49
00:02:27.620 --> 00:02:29.810
So, usually, if I'm gonna actually
going to be bringing this in,

50
00:02:29.810 --> 00:02:31.570
I may not have the same columns.

51
00:02:31.570 --> 00:02:33.220
I can go ahead and actually create.

52
00:02:33.220 --> 00:02:36.730
Hey, here's what this column inside
of Excel is gonna match up to,

53
00:02:36.730 --> 00:02:37.770
inside of project.

54
00:02:37.770 --> 00:02:39.670
So, I'm just gonna do a new map.

55
00:02:39.670 --> 00:02:42.250
And now, it's gonna ask me what I wanna
do, whether I'm gonna append or merge.

56
00:02:42.250 --> 00:02:44.340
I'm gonna do this as a new project.

57
00:02:44.340 --> 00:02:45.550
And click Next.

58
00:02:45.550 --> 00:02:48.400
And it's gonna ask what I want
to bring over if I have it.

59
00:02:48.400 --> 00:02:52.850
So notice I have Task, I have Resources,
I may have assignments inside of Excel.

60
00:02:52.850 --> 00:02:55.380
I may not, so
I may actually have to choose what I want.

61
00:02:55.380 --> 00:02:57.110
Go ahead and click Next.

62
00:02:58.610 --> 00:02:59.730
And from that point,

63
00:02:59.730 --> 00:03:02.560
it's asking me what the source of
my worksheet name is gonna be.

64
00:03:02.560 --> 00:03:03.499
It's gonna be Tasks.

65
00:03:04.530 --> 00:03:10.230
And then, all I do is I come down here and
I actually match it to the proper name.

66
00:03:10.230 --> 00:03:13.520
And this is the one that always got me,
because the side of Microsoft Project does

67
00:03:13.520 --> 00:03:17.100
not attach the name the way that I thought
it would be, this always Name here.

68
00:03:18.330 --> 00:03:20.420
Click Next, and click Finish.

69
00:03:20.420 --> 00:03:21.340
And there it is.

70
00:03:21.340 --> 00:03:26.160
We now begin and
now I have at least a basic task list

71
00:03:26.160 --> 00:03:29.790
that I can have ready to go and
be able to bring that into Excel.

72
00:03:29.790 --> 00:03:31.840
But that's not what we're
talking about today, right?

73
00:03:31.840 --> 00:03:34.150
You're probably saying, well Ronnie,
why'd you bring us through that?

74
00:03:34.150 --> 00:03:36.310
Well that's part of what
we have to understand,

75
00:03:36.310 --> 00:03:39.970
is that if we can import it in
there we can also export it too.

76
00:03:39.970 --> 00:03:43.620
And the export's just as
easy if go back to File, and

77
00:03:43.620 --> 00:03:48.400
I select Save As, and I'm just gonna
bring it into my Documents folder.

78
00:03:49.500 --> 00:03:53.870
And instead, I can click on the drop-down
box that will allow me to say, hey,

79
00:03:53.870 --> 00:03:55.940
what type am I actually saving it?

80
00:03:55.940 --> 00:03:58.290
And notice it gives me
several different options.

81
00:03:58.290 --> 00:04:03.370
Previous version of project, but
notice I have Excel WorkBooks and

82
00:04:03.370 --> 00:04:08.950
I can even say it has CSV files for
imported to other database programs.

83
00:04:08.950 --> 00:04:12.760
But let's just do this as
an Excel WorkBook, and then I can save it.

84
00:04:13.790 --> 00:04:16.010
And when I do this in a moment, notice,

85
00:04:16.010 --> 00:04:18.170
hey look at that it's
actually the same thing.

86
00:04:18.170 --> 00:04:20.200
It brings me through that Export Wizard.

87
00:04:20.200 --> 00:04:21.510
So, it's a little bit different.

88
00:04:21.510 --> 00:04:24.220
It's not what we normally think as,
okay, just automatically saves it.

89
00:04:24.220 --> 00:04:28.200
It actually allows me to now take
those options and do the same thing.

90
00:04:28.200 --> 00:04:33.865
Do I want the entire project Excel
template that they already have ready or

91
00:04:33.865 --> 00:04:37.695
I can do selected data and
I just continue to follow it through and

92
00:04:37.695 --> 00:04:42.215
it will go ahead and finish up for me and
oh, it says my filter can't be found, so

93
00:04:42.215 --> 00:04:44.195
I did something a little different there.

94
00:04:44.195 --> 00:04:47.735
>> Yeah, so Ronnie, I've had to mess
with this one more than I care to.

95
00:04:47.735 --> 00:04:50.515
That default template of grabbing
the whole project, you'll find

96
00:04:50.515 --> 00:04:53.405
there's a lot of stuff in project that
isn't quite compatible with Excel.

97
00:04:53.405 --> 00:04:54.765
And so you'll get little messages.

98
00:04:54.765 --> 00:04:58.600
That error message you're getting right
there is actually because of the project

99
00:04:58.600 --> 00:04:59.770
roll up task.

100
00:04:59.770 --> 00:05:03.368
So the way I normally use it is by
highlighting particular pieces of data.

101
00:05:03.368 --> 00:05:06.120
And if you notice on the wizard it gave
Ronnie that option to export the whole

102
00:05:06.120 --> 00:05:08.610
project, which I find
is pretty problematic.

103
00:05:08.610 --> 00:05:10.350
Or to select the data.

104
00:05:10.350 --> 00:05:12.830
So normally what happens is I'll have some

105
00:05:12.830 --> 00:05:16.530
company that I'm gonna be sub-contracting
out some of the activities to.

106
00:05:16.530 --> 00:05:20.540
And so I might just highlight the
activities I want them to deal with, and

107
00:05:20.540 --> 00:05:21.980
then I go and I run this wizard and

108
00:05:21.980 --> 00:05:25.380
I choose just the Selected Data, and
it's just gonna export those activities.

109
00:05:25.380 --> 00:05:27.680
Or the resources that I've highlighted,
or whatever.

110
00:05:27.680 --> 00:05:31.210
And that really helps to avoid a lot
of the errors that come out of that.

111
00:05:31.210 --> 00:05:33.820
But it can be a little sensitive and
finicky.

112
00:05:33.820 --> 00:05:38.246
Another way, the cheating way, to quickly
get data in Excel is you can highlight

113
00:05:38.246 --> 00:05:42.300
data in Project, you can just copy and
paste it right into Excel too.

114
00:05:42.300 --> 00:05:45.810
That's a lot faster even in
some cases to do it that way.

115
00:05:45.810 --> 00:05:49.650
So it's really up to you, but at the end
of the day the user interface in Project

116
00:05:49.650 --> 00:05:51.920
is really built off of
the same framework as Excel.

117
00:05:51.920 --> 00:05:54.080
So they're pretty compatible and
you'll find it's a quick and

118
00:05:54.080 --> 00:05:55.720
easy way to get that data out.

119
00:05:55.720 --> 00:05:57.260
It in the software that
other people do have.

120
00:05:58.260 --> 00:05:59.800
>> So
there's multiple ways we can do that.

121
00:05:59.800 --> 00:06:02.940
But Excel is one of the ways that they
really do recommend that you know how

122
00:06:02.940 --> 00:06:05.800
to be able to get access to, and
be able to get the data out of

123
00:06:05.800 --> 00:06:09.490
project when you're actually ready for
it to come out to do that as well.

124
00:06:09.490 --> 00:06:14.370
Now, the other thing that we can also
do is that inside of our project plan,

125
00:06:14.370 --> 00:06:19.270
there may be actual documents that
we wanna keep track of as well.

126
00:06:19.270 --> 00:06:21.780
And you might be wondering like,
well why would I need to do that.

127
00:06:21.780 --> 00:06:24.420
Well sometimes you do have other
information that's available for

128
00:06:24.420 --> 00:06:25.750
you inside of a project.

129
00:06:25.750 --> 00:06:31.430
But yes it's actually in a document
format such as a PDF or Notepad,

130
00:06:31.430 --> 00:06:33.210
text document of some sort.

131
00:06:33.210 --> 00:06:36.290
And you wanna actually be able to know,
hey, where is that normally linked?

132
00:06:36.290 --> 00:06:38.330
So it might be something like this.

133
00:06:38.330 --> 00:06:40.840
Okay?
So, let's say that 3.1.

134
00:06:40.840 --> 00:06:45.760
After we finish the tuning phase of
my project, what ended up happening

135
00:06:45.760 --> 00:06:49.680
is that at some point here, somebody said,
hey look when we pulled up everything and

136
00:06:49.680 --> 00:06:52.690
we were ready to install these cubicles,
we looked at the carpet, it was terrible.

137
00:06:52.690 --> 00:06:55.170
So, we wanted to pull that out and
put new carpet in.

138
00:06:55.170 --> 00:06:57.220
We added in a new task.

139
00:06:57.220 --> 00:06:59.330
Well, I may actually go ahead and

140
00:06:59.330 --> 00:07:03.660
have something that was a sheet that
somebody actually sent to me saying,

141
00:07:03.660 --> 00:07:06.590
here's what we're adding in, and
here's the authorization to do that.

142
00:07:06.590 --> 00:07:10.800
But we can simply link this task then to
be able to do something like that as well.

143
00:07:10.800 --> 00:07:14.820
If I right click on this task,
I can select a Hyperlink.

144
00:07:16.450 --> 00:07:20.080
And when I do that I can link it to well,
where my document may be.

145
00:07:20.080 --> 00:07:22.570
Let's say it's actually just
a project formulas here.

146
00:07:22.570 --> 00:07:24.240
And I click OK.

147
00:07:24.240 --> 00:07:26.620
And then if I now aren't
able to select that,

148
00:07:26.620 --> 00:07:27.880
it should actually say hey here it is.

149
00:07:27.880 --> 00:07:30.560
There's a potential security concern.

150
00:07:30.560 --> 00:07:32.640
There's no security concern on this one,
and

151
00:07:32.640 --> 00:07:36.400
I can bring that information up just
about immediately to be able to see that.

152
00:07:36.400 --> 00:07:37.240
So, we can link it there, and

153
00:07:37.240 --> 00:07:41.300
if I actually had a regular
URL that we can go to.

154
00:07:41.300 --> 00:07:44.700
If there's a website we wanted to go to,
we could also do that as well and

155
00:07:44.700 --> 00:07:46.280
just have that show up.

156
00:07:46.280 --> 00:07:49.820
Do you know to add that in, it gives me
a nice little visual reminder that I can

157
00:07:49.820 --> 00:07:54.790
include in other information that's
not really directly in project itself?

158
00:07:54.790 --> 00:07:58.000
But I can have it right there and
ready to go if I need to.

159
00:07:58.000 --> 00:08:00.060
>> Yeah, that's a neat way to get
little things linked in there, and

160
00:08:00.060 --> 00:08:04.000
it is normally gonna be when this
is just some kind of Pointer to,

161
00:08:04.000 --> 00:08:07.700
sometimes you'll see where their pointers
do on external calendaring system or

162
00:08:07.700 --> 00:08:10.100
some kind of event page or whatever.

163
00:08:10.100 --> 00:08:13.530
But Ronnie, what if we've got
something a little bit different?

164
00:08:13.530 --> 00:08:17.990
What if, for example,
if you're managing a project out there and

165
00:08:17.990 --> 00:08:21.370
you're gonna generate a lot of
supporting documents as you go, right?

166
00:08:21.370 --> 00:08:26.420
So using your example there, the carpet we
probably had to get a quote from somebody,

167
00:08:26.420 --> 00:08:29.010
so we probably have something
like a PDF that's a quote.

168
00:08:29.010 --> 00:08:31.990
Or we might get a change ticket, right?

169
00:08:31.990 --> 00:08:34.980
We fill out the change request form, and
we get that approved and signed off,

170
00:08:34.980 --> 00:08:37.200
and And maybe that's a PDF or an XPS,

171
00:08:37.200 --> 00:08:40.900
maybe it's a Word document, and
I want to keep track of these.

172
00:08:40.900 --> 00:08:44.130
Well, when you do a link like you just
did, the link is pointing to some

173
00:08:44.130 --> 00:08:47.470
external location, and
we can only have one link, right.

174
00:08:47.470 --> 00:08:49.830
Well, what if I want to link to three or
four different documents?

175
00:08:49.830 --> 00:08:51.500
What if I don't want it to be external,
right?

176
00:08:51.500 --> 00:08:52.620
What if that link changes?

177
00:08:52.620 --> 00:08:55.290
I want these documents to
become part of the project.

178
00:08:55.290 --> 00:08:56.170
Is there a way we can do that?

179
00:08:57.310 --> 00:09:02.250
If we go ahead and, let me see if I
can do this here, right-click and

180
00:09:02.250 --> 00:09:03.090
go to the information.

181
00:09:08.090 --> 00:09:10.480
And it is-
>> It's right under Notes.

182
00:09:10.480 --> 00:09:12.340
>> Yep, the notes, yeah, that's right.

183
00:09:12.340 --> 00:09:15.490
>> We kind of went into this a little bit
earlier where you've got this notes field

184
00:09:15.490 --> 00:09:17.250
where you can punch in whatever you want,
right.

185
00:09:17.250 --> 00:09:18.920
You can punch in just data.

186
00:09:18.920 --> 00:09:20.250
You type it in there and that's great.

187
00:09:20.250 --> 00:09:24.620
But what a lot of people don't realize
is you can, I call it smuggling.

188
00:09:24.620 --> 00:09:27.180
You can smuggle documents in here and

189
00:09:27.180 --> 00:09:32.255
I love to do this because if you're got
a whole collection of PDFs Can XPS and

190
00:09:32.255 --> 00:09:35.565
all these other documents
that are laying around, well

191
00:09:35.565 --> 00:09:40.375
if you copy your project file to another
location, those links might break, right.

192
00:09:40.375 --> 00:09:43.425
Or maybe you've got to remember to
copy all these other files with it.

193
00:09:43.425 --> 00:09:48.775
If you're trying to create one big massive
project file that has everything you want,

194
00:09:48.775 --> 00:09:50.855
you can actually use these
notes fields to do it.

195
00:09:50.855 --> 00:09:55.240
So Ronny's just typing in a little note
there right, but when he goes in there,

196
00:09:55.240 --> 00:09:59.410
you'll see where you can start to add
in objects, this insert object field.

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don discuss the power of Projects Reporting tools.  Microsoft Project makes it fairly intuitive to create presentation ready reports by default.  They provide the most common reports likely needed and give you the ability to create custom reports when the default options are not what you need.
episodes.title: Reports and Dashboards

Project is really trying to

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don talk about and show some of the different way to make Project 2013 extend it's capabilities by using applications, saving to one drive and using VBA to complete repeating tasks. These option make project a very extensible tool to apply it any project you choose to manage.
episodes.title: Project Extensions

Again, well we don't have to choose one or
